intro: Bergia odorata, commonly known as the fragrant bergia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is commonly referred to as the "ice plant" family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. Bergia odorata thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun exposure. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and unique fragrance.
